header.title: wxGridSizer

description.p: A grid sizer is a sizer which lays out its children in a two-dimensional table with all table fields having the same size, i.e. the width of each field is the width of the widest child, the height of each field is the height of the tallest child.
This class is derived (and can use functions) from: wxSizer

func.fsummary: Returns the number of columns that has been specified for the sizer.

desc.p: Returns the number of columns that has been specified for the sizer.

Returns zero if the sizer is automatically adjusting the number of columns depending on number of its children. To get the effective number of columns or rows being currently used, see GetEffectiveColsCount() (not implemented in wx)

func.fsummary: Returns the horizontal gap (in pixels) between cells in the sizer.

desc.p: Returns the horizontal gap (in pixels) between cells in the sizer.

func.fsummary: Returns the number of rows that has been specified for the sizer.

desc.p: Returns the number of rows that has been specified for the sizer.

Returns zero if the sizer is automatically adjusting the number of rows depending on number of its children. To get the effective number of columns or rows being currently used, see GetEffectiveRowsCount() (not implemented in wx).
